glsa.title: DirectFB: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in DirectFB, all of which could allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: DirectFB (Direct Frame Buffer) is a set of graphics APIs implemented on top of the Linux Frame Buffer (fbdev) abstraction layer.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in DirectFB. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: Remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or execute arbitrary code via the Voodoo interface.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All DirectFB users should upgrade to the latest version:
